lexUnit.name: gasp.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a convulsive catching of breath

sentence.text: She gave a tiny strangled gasp and shuddered , feeling the waves of shock coursing along her veins .
Li Yuan 's look of surprise as the Arab reared brought gasps as well as laughter from all round .
There were gasps and whistles at the magnitude of the figure .
She sat up with a gasp and blew her nose hard ; then , since he was close , she rested her aching head against his ample stomach .
Unfortunately , Owen was much fitter than me , and he soon disappeared , leaving me with only my gasps and puffs for company .
A little boy ran up , face dirty , clothes dishevelled , his breath coming in short gasps so he could hardly speak .
The terror bound her chest so that her breath came in the short , dry , painful gasps of a dying asthmatic .
There was a gasp of consternation from Annie .
Instinctively Ruth 's hand came up to cover her mouth , to smother the gasp of shock breaking from her lips .
The young private at the wheel let out a gasp of surprise .
In 1978 he delivered a lecture at the London University Institute of Education , accompanied by his photographs of the magnificent finds in the tombs , which brought gasps from the audience .
There was the sound of wood splitting and tearing , followed by a choking gasp from the open grave .
There was a gasp at this disclosure .
His breath was coming in short irregular gasps .
Just once , as the waves came up over her feet , she hesitated and gave a short gasp , as anyone might have done at the sudden cold .
Her gasp mirrored the shock of pain in her eyes .
Her head shot round , her shocked gasp mingling with the audible hiss of sharply indrawn breath .
Rachel carried on fighting , hoarse gasps coming from her throat .
